attributes.action: prevent pharmacists withholding contraception on religious grounds
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Recently a 36 year old woman went to a pharmacist in a major high street supermarket to obtain emergency contraception as her usual method of contraception had failed.

She was denied access to the emergency contraceptive pill because of the pharmacist's personal religious beliefs.

This is unacceptable - pharmacists should make such decisions based solely on sound medical reasons, they should not be permitted to allow their personal religious beliefs to restrict other people's access to contraception.

Dispensing emergency contraception where it is needed is part of the pharmacist's job. 

We should not permit pharmacists to let their personal prejudices stand in the way of other people's access to important pharmaceutical products.
